DOC.brief_summary: This international , randomize , control , parallel group study patient ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction ( STEMI ) allocate one following : Manual aspiration thrombectomy Percutaneous Coronary Intervention ( PCI ) PCI alone .
DOC.brief_title: A Trial Routine Aspiration Thrombectomy With Percutaneous Coronary Intervention ( PCI ) Versus PCI Alone Patients With ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction ( STEMI ) Undergoing Primary PCI
DOC.detailed_description: The hypothesis TOTAL routine use manual aspiration thrombectomy aspiration catheter ( Export® ) PCI compare PCI alone reduce incidence cardiovascular death , recurrent myocardial infarction , cardiogenic shock , new worsen NYHA Class IV heart failure ( HF ) 180 day patient STEMI undergo primary PCI .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients present : Symptoms myocardial ischemia last ≥ 30 minute AND Definite ECG change indicate STEMI : ST elevation great 0.1 mV two contiguous limb lead 0.2 mV two contiguous precordial lead 2 . Referred primary PCI 3 . Randomized within 12 hour symptom onset prior diagnostic angiography 4 . Informed consent 1 . Age ≤ 18 year 2 . Prior coronary artery bypass surgery ( CABG ) 3 . Life expectancy less six month due noncardiac condition 4 . Treatment fibrinolytic therapy qualify index STEMI event
